reviewText: I saw this movie at the Atlanta Jewish Film Festival a year ago and loved it.  As a Jew and an engineer, this exercise in combining architecture, art and religion was an interesting idea for those of us used to the normal concept of what a Sukkah should look like.  The designs selected, built and displayed in New York's Union Square ranged from the ridiculous to the sublime, but the selection process and the execution make for a fun little flick.  If you're Jewish, a New Yorker, or both, you ought to give this one a look-see.
